none: Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
University of Southern California. Trojan Marching Band (Performer)
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music
University of Southern California. Trojan Marching Band
Rodgers, Richard, 1902-1979. Sound of music. My favorite things
Styne, Jule, 1905-1994. Gypsy. Everything's coming up roses

Coverage of the January 1, 1996 Rose Bowl Game between the Northwestern Wildcats and the Southern California Trojans. A CBS Sunday Morning segment highlights Northwestern University's historic appearances in the 1948/1949 and 1995/1996 Rose Bowl games. The program features an overview of the season's games and interviews with former player Alex Sarkisian, Music School Dean Fred Hemke, coach Gary Barnett, and players Darnell Autry and Steve Schnur. Also included is the parade in Disneyland and network coverage of the 107th Tournament of Roses parade including performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band and the University of Southern California Trojan Marching Band. Northwestern's band plays "My Favorite Things" and "Go U Northwestern," and USC's band plays "Everything's Coming Up Roses." Before the Rose Bowl, short interviews and features about the Northwestern Wildcats are shown, including one by Charleton Heston. The USC Trojan Marching Band performs the National Anthem and the Rose Bowl begins. Halftime performances by the Northwestern University Marching band include selections from Rossini's "Barber of Seville," Camille Saint-Saëns' "Samson and Delilah," and Puccini's "Turandot." After being undefeated in the Big Ten, the Northwestern Wildcats ultimately lose the Rose Bowl to the USC Trojans by a score of 32-41.

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
